revised_title: Pepys Commemoration Service and Fairchild Lectures
tldr: The article discusses the annual Pepys Commemoration Service held at St Olave's Church, which was damaged during World War II. It also mentions the Fairchild Lectures, delivered at various locations, attended by representatives from the Royal Society. The article highlights the resilience of the scientific community during wartime.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science
